item.title: Delaying August Recess, Senate Republicans To Release Updated Health Care Bill
item.description: July 11, 2017 - The new bill will be released Thursday and could come to the floor next week. Majority Leader Mitch McConnell has also delayed the Senate's August recess by two weeks.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 11, 2017 - The new bill will be released Thursday and could come to the floor next week. Majority Leader Mitch McConnell has also delayed the Senate's August recess by two weeks. http://www.npr.org/2017/07/11/536704485/delaying-august-recess-senate-republicans-to-release-updated-health-care-bill

item.title: Senate Republicans Press Forward Despite Sharp Division On Health Care Bill
item.description: July 11, 2017 - Senate Republicans regrouped on Tuesday, as they tried to forge a path forward on health care legislation. The White House and GOP leaders pressed forward with the goal of voting next week.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 11, 2017 - Senate Republicans regrouped on Tuesday, as they tried to forge a path forward on health care legislation. The White House and GOP leaders pressed forward with the goal of voting next week. http://www.npr.org/2017/07/11/536699776/senate-republicans-press-forward-despite-sharp-division-on-health-care-bill

item.title: In Texas, People With Mental Illness Are Finding Work Helping Peers
item.description: July 11, 2017 - Giving people who have serious mental illness peer support has proved so helpful that some states are starting to pay these peer specialists to bridge the gap when there aren't enough professionals.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 11, 2017 - Giving people who have serious mental illness peer support has proved so helpful that some states are starting to pay these peer specialists to bridge the gap when there aren't enough professionals. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/07/11/536501069/in-texas-people-with-mental-illness-are-finding-work-helping-peers

item.title: What This Teen Mom Wishes She'd Known Before She Got Pregnant
item.description: July 11, 2017 - She was ashamed to be seen buying condoms. She didn't dare ask her mother for advice. So how can Uganda bring down its high rate of teen pregnancy?
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 11, 2017 - She was ashamed to be seen buying condoms. She didn't dare ask her mother for advice. So how can Uganda bring down its high rate of teen pregnancy? http://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2017/07/11/536428219/what-this-teen-mom-wishes-shed-known-before-she-got-pregnant

item.title: Credit Agencies To Ease Up On Medical Debt Reporting
item.description: July 11, 2017 - Starting in September, the three main credit agencies will wait 180 days before including medical debt on a credit report, giving consumers time to resolve disputes with insurers.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 11, 2017 - Starting in September, the three main credit agencies will wait 180 days before including medical debt on a credit report, giving consumers time to resolve disputes with insurers. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/07/11/536501809/credit-agencies-to-ease-up-on-medical-debt-reporting

item.title: 'Game Of Thrones' Finds Fans Among Disability Rights Activists, Too
item.description: July 10, 2017 - Several main characters in the HBO series happen to have disabilities. "I had never seen my own experience in life reflected so accurately, so vividly, so viscerally," says one disability activist.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 10, 2017 - Several main characters in the HBO series happen to have disabilities. "I had never seen my own experience in life reflected so accurately, so vividly, so viscerally," says one disability activist. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/07/10/536052787/game-of-thrones-finds-fans-among-disability-rights-activists-too

item.title: Tech Design Ethicist Works To Raise Awareness Of Internet Addiction
item.description: July 10, 2017 - Former Google design ethicist Tristan Harris explains how tech companies make their products hard to resist. He now advocates for a Hippocratic Oath for tech designers.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 10, 2017 - Former Google design ethicist Tristan Harris explains how tech companies make their products hard to resist. He now advocates for a Hippocratic Oath for tech designers. http://www.npr.org/2017/07/10/536505290/tech-design-ethicist-works-to-raise-awareness-of-internet-addiction

item.title: Health Care Debate Heats Up In Mitch McConnell's Home State Of Kentucky
item.description: July 10, 2017 - Voters in Kentucky react to the efforts by Senate Republicans to repeal and replace the Affordable Care Act. The Senate bill is extremely unpopular, especially in Kentucky, where Obamacare had great success.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 10, 2017 - Voters in Kentucky react to the efforts by Senate Republicans to repeal and replace the Affordable Care Act. The Senate bill is extremely unpopular, especially in Kentucky, where Obamacare had great success. http://www.npr.org/2017/07/10/536505348/health-care-debate-heats-up-in-mitch-mcconnells-home-state-of-kentucky

item.title: Survey Says: Medicaid Recipients Really Like Their Coverage And Care
item.description: July 10, 2017 - A new survey shows that Medicaid beneficiaries are happy with their care and don't have trouble finding a doctor.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 10, 2017 - A new survey shows that Medicaid beneficiaries are happy with their care and don't have trouble finding a doctor. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/07/10/536448362/survey-says-medicaid-recipients-like-their-coverage-and-care

item.title: FAQ: How Would The Republican Health Care Bills Affect You?
item.description: July 10, 2017 - The bills under consideration in Congress would make big changes in health care coverage and costs for millions of people. Our searchable FAQ provides answers to key questions on where, how and why.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 10, 2017 - The bills under consideration in Congress would make big changes in health care coverage and costs for millions of people. Our searchable FAQ provides answers to key questions on where, how and why. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/07/10/535851043/faq-how-would-the-republican-health-care-bills-affect-you

item.title: Women With High-Risk Pregnancies Are More Likely To Develop Heart Disease
item.description: July 10, 2017 - Women who develop diabetes or high blood pressure during pregnancy, or whose babies are born prematurely, often are unaware of their own increased risk of heart disease later. So are their doctors.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 10, 2017 - Women who develop diabetes or high blood pressure during pregnancy, or whose babies are born prematurely, often are unaware of their own increased risk of heart disease later. So are their doctors. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/07/10/535644276/women-with-high-risk-pregnancies-are-more-likely-to-develop-heart-disease

item.title: Words You'll Hear: The Better Care Reconciliation Act
item.description: July 9, 2017 - Republican senators are trying to revive their health care bill. While voters weren't fond of the the original version, but they're not always clear about what they want when it comes to health care.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 9, 2017 - Republican senators are trying to revive their health care bill. While voters weren't fond of the the original version, but they're not always clear about what they want when it comes to health care. http://www.npr.org/2017/07/09/536328454/words-youll-hear-the-better-care-reconciliation-act

item.title: Facing Cancer Is Even Tougher If The Only Radiation Machine Is Broken
item.description: July 9, 2017 - That's the situation in Senegal. The government has promised to buy new machines. But one cancer specialist says there isn't enough attention given to the disease.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 9, 2017 - That's the situation in Senegal. The government has promised to buy new machines. But one cancer specialist says there isn't enough attention given to the disease. http://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2017/07/09/524534109/a-country-where-it-can-be-tough-to-get-cancer-treatment

item.title: For Many, Medicaid Provides The Only Route To Mental Health Care
item.description: July 9, 2017 - The Senate's proposed rollback of the Medicaid expansion could cut off mental health benefits to many people who have gotten care for the first time as a result of the Affordable Care Act.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 9, 2017 - The Senate's proposed rollback of the Medicaid expansion could cut off mental health benefits to many people who have gotten care for the first time as a result of the Affordable Care Act. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/07/09/535793983/for-many-medicaid-provides-the-only-route-to-mental-health-care

item.title: 3 Doctors On What Works And Doesn't Work In U.S. Health Care
item.description: July 8, 2017 - Doctors Julie Gunter, Rob Stone and Gary Sobelson talk with Scott Simon about the problems with American health care and what they think of the current Republican health care plan.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 8, 2017 - Doctors Julie Gunter, Rob Stone and Gary Sobelson talk with Scott Simon about the problems with American health care and what they think of the current Republican health care plan. http://www.npr.org/2017/07/08/536125083/3-doctors-on-what-works-and-doesnt-work-in-u-s-health-care
